Summary: Initially, bright negative magnitude object to naked eye, few degrees east of Jupiter...Through telescope, satellite-like, dish, antenna, flashing lights (red and white)
trends: There have been no other sightings in Wellsburg
This sighting has never been favorited.
divs: Sighting DetailsDuring a scheduled "starwatch" at Brooke Hills Park, near Wellsburg, WV, several experienced amateur observers were unable to identify what appeared to be a bright, unblinking, object, a few degrees to the east of Jupiter in the sky. It moved very little as viewed by the naked eye and appeared to get brighter. Upon viewing with a 12.5" reflector telescope, (approx. 136 power) it appeared as near the size of jupiter in field of view. Details were visible... round, radar-like dish that was light blue in color, antenna, blinking red and whitish lights... "it looked like a radar dish aimed at the viewer". While being viewed through the telescope, it exploded with debris expanding outward, tumbling chunks and trailing... The general feeling was that a satellite-like object had entered and burned in the atmosphere, likely a communications satellite. Since there was nothing in the news, or online about a "missing satellite", it seemed a good idea to report.
